thread.title: Brad Paisley Says 2015 Has Been Comedy Gold for His CMA Awards Monologue
thread.title_full: Brad Paisley Says 2015 Has Been Comedy Gold for His CMA Awards Monologue

title: Brad Paisley Says 2015 Has Been Comedy Gold for His CMA Awards Monologue
text:
Brad Paisley Says 2015 Has Been Comedy Gold for His CMA Awards Monologue Posted just a moment ago 
CMA (NASHVILLE) -- Country Music Association Awards hosts Brad Paisley and Carrie Underwood plan to have a field day when they emcee the upcoming ceremony, drawing on some of the recent scandals in the news, including the Ashley Madison website hack. 
"I guess it's the wrong thing to say, but God bless the Ashley Madison website hack for many reasons," Paisley says, before Underwood clarifies, "The hack. Not the website itself." 
While Brad doesn't condone using the cheating website, he is glad it exists for the purposes of the CMA Awards monologue. He says, "If anybody has a right to deal with a cheating website, it's us. Don't you think? In country music." 
The current political election will also provide some great comedy bits. "This election has been just amazing," Brad adds. "They give us sound bites. We can't keep up." 
Country superstars Underwood and Paisley co-host the 49th Annual CMA Awards Wednesday, November 4 at 8 p.m. ET on ABC.
